sen.j: 博多織（はかたおり）とは、福岡県福岡市のおもに博多で特産とされる絹織物。
sen.e: "Hakata ori textile" refers to a silk textile, a local speciality of mainly Hakata in Hakata City, Fukuoka Prefecture.
"Hakata ori textile" refers to a silk textile, a local speciality of mainly Hakata in Hakata City, Fukuoka Prefecture.
Hakata-ori textile refers to a silk textile, a local speciality of mainly Hakata in Fukuoka City, Fukuoka Prefecture.
sen.cmt: Hakata-ori textileとし、Hakata City→Fukuoka Cityに修正、クォーテーション削除

sen.j: 献上博多などとも呼ばれる。
sen.e: It is also called "Kenjo Hakata (present to the shogunate from Hakata)."
It is also called "Kenjo Hakata (present to the shogunate from Hakata)."
It is also called Kenjo Hakata (present to the shogunate from Hakata).
sen.cmt: クォーテーション削除

sen.j: 特徴
sen.e: Feature
Feature
Feature

sen.j: 細い経糸（たていと）を多く用い、太い緯糸（よこいと）を筬で強く打ち込み、おもに経糸を浮かせて柄を織り出すのが博多織の特徴。
sen.e: It is made with a lot of thin warps and strongly drawn by bulky wefts with a reed, and the design of Hakata ori textile woven by raising warps as its feature.
It is made with a lot of thin warps and strongly drawn by bulky wefts with a reed, and is characterized by the design of Hakata ori textile woven with raised warps.
It is made with a lot of thin warps and strongly drawn by bulky wefts with a reed, and is characterized by the design of Hakata-ori textile woven with raised warps.

sen.j: 先染めまたは先練り。
sen.e: It has sakizome (previously dyed yarn) or sakineri (previously refined yarn).
It has sakizome (previously dyed yarn) or sakineri (previously refined yarn).
It has sakizome (previously dyed yarn) or sakineri (previously refined yarn).

sen.j: 材料は絹糸・金糸・銀糸など。
sen.e: Its materials are silk thread, gold thread and silver thread.
Its materials are silk thread, gold thread and silver thread.
Its materials are silk thread, gold thread and silver thread.

sen.j: 生地に厚みや張りがあって、帯としての用途に適する。
sen.e: The fabric has thickness and firmness, which is good for obi sash.
sen.cmt: 帯→sashを、obi sashにしてみました。
sen.e: The fabric has thickness and firmness, which is excellent for use as an obi sash.
The fabric has thickness and firmness, which is excellent for use as an obi sash.

sen.j: 博多帯の締め心地には定評があり、締める際には「キュッキュッ」と絹鳴りする。
sen.e: The condition of tying Hakata obi sash has an established reputation, and it makes silk squeak when tying it.
The Hakata obi sash has a reputation for making silk make a satisfying squeak when tying it.
The Hakata obi sash has a reputation for making silk make a satisfying squeak when tying it.

sen.j: 大相撲は幕下以上にならなければ博多帯を締めることを許されない。
sen.e: In professional sumo, only wrestlers with the rank of "makushita" or above are allowed to tie Hakata obi sash.
In professional sumo, only wrestlers with the rank of "makushita" or above are allowed to tie Hakata obi sash.
In professional sumo, only wrestlers with the rank of makushita or above are allowed to tie Hakata obi sash.
sen.cmt: クォーテーション削除

sen.j: 博多織の中でも上質な「献上博多」は、金剛杵と華皿（ともに仏具）と子持ち縞をあしらった模様が特徴。
sen.e: "Kenjo Hakata" with especially high quality as Hakata ori textile, features design with a Vajra club (a pestle-like object with pointed ends), a flower tray (both are Buddhist altar articles), and komochi-shima (uneven stripped pattern).

"Kenjo Hakata" with especially high quality as Hakata ori textile, features design with a Vajra club (a pestle-like object with pointed ends), a flower tray (both are Buddhist altar articles), and komochi-shima (uneven stripped pattern).

Kenjo Hakata' with especially high quality as Hakata-ori textile, features design with a Vajra club (a pestle-like object with pointed ends), a flower tray (both are Buddhist altar articles), and komochi-shima (uneven stripped pattern).
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更、Hakata-ori textileとしました。

sen.j: 献上博多は福岡市交通局博多駅のシンボルマークともなっている。
sen.e: Kenjo Hakata is also a symbol of Hakata Station of Fukuoka City Transportation Bureau.
Kenjo Hakata is also a symbol of the Hakata Station of Fukuoka City Transportation Bureau.
Kenjo Hakata is also a symbol of the Hakata Station of Fukuoka City Transportation Bureau.

sen.j: 現在ではほとんど博多織製品は機械織りによる。
sen.e: Currently, Hakata-ori products are mostly made by machine weaving.
sen.cmt: 機械織り→machine weaveをmachine weavingにしました。
sen.e: Currently, Hakata-ori products are mostly made by machine weaving.
Currently, Hakata-ori products are mostly made by machine weaving.

sen.j: 産地は博多のみならず、福岡市内・福岡県内外各地に広がっている。
sen.e: Production areas are found in Fukuoka City and various regions in and out of Fukuoka Prefecture as well as Hakata.
Production areas are found in Fukuoka City and various regions in and out of Fukuoka Prefecture as well as Hakata.
Production areas are found in Fukuoka City and various regions in and out of Fukuoka Prefecture as well as Hakata.

sen.j: 博多織工業組合が取りまとめを行い、博多織の品質を証明する証紙の発行などをおこなう。
sen.e: Hakata-ori Textile Industrial Association makes coordination such as issuing a certificate sticker to certificate the quality of Hakata ori textile.
sen.cmt: 証紙→a certificate stampは、意味が違うと思うので、certification stickerにしました。
sen.e: Hakata-ori Textile Industrial Association coordinates such actions such as issuing a sticker to certify the quality of Hakata ori textile.
Hakata-ori Textile Industrial Association coordinates such actions such as issuing a sticker to certify the quality of Hakata ori textile.

sen.j: 「博多織」の商標は博多織工業組合が有し、地域団体商標として2007年に再提出もしている。
sen.e: Hakata-ori Textile Industrial Association owns the trademark "Hakata-ori," and reintroduced it as a regional organization trademark in 2007.
Hakata-ori Textile Industrial Association owns the trademark "Hakata-ori," and reintroduced it as a regional organization trademark in 2007.
Hakata-ori Textile Industrial Association owns the trademark 'Hakata-ori,' and reintroduced it as a regional organization trademark in 2007.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: また博多織は伝統的な和装への利用のみならず、「HAKATA JAPAN」の商標で洋服や鞄・財布への活用がなされている。
sen.e: Hakata ori textile is used for Western clothing, bags or purses as well as traditional Japanese dresses, as the trademark, "HAKATA JAPAN."
Hakata ori textile is used for Western clothing, bags or purses as well as traditional Japanese dresses, as the trademark, "HAKATA JAPAN."
Hakata-ori textile is used for Western clothing, bags or purses as well as traditional Japanese dresses, as the trademark, "HAKATA JAPAN."

sen.j: 桂由美の手による教皇ヨハネ・パウロ2世 (ローマ教皇)の祭服にも博多織が用いられた。
sen.e: Hakata ori textile is also used for the vestment of Pope John Paul the Second (Pope of the Catholic Church) made by Yumi KATSURA.
Hakata ori textile is also used for the vestment of Pope John Paul the Second (Pope of the Catholic Church) made by Yumi KATSURA.
Hakata-ori textile is also used for the vestment of Pope John PAUL the Second (Pope of the Catholic Church) made by Yumi KATSURA.
sen.cmt: John Paul→John PAULに修正、Hakata-ori textileとしました。

sen.j: 櫛田神社 (福岡市)そばの「博多町家ふるさと館」では博多織の手織り実演がなされている。
sen.e: "Hakata machiya Furusatokan (Hakata townsman houses in Hometown Hall)" near Kushida-jinja Shrine (Fukuoka City) has hand weaving demonstration of Hakata ori textile.
"Hakata machiya Furusatokan (Hakata townsman houses in Hometown Hall)" near Kushida-jinja Shrine (Fukuoka City) holds a hand weaving demonstration of Hakata ori textile.
Hakata Machiya Furusatokan' (Hakata townsman houses in Hometown Hall) near Kushida-jinja Shrine (Fukuoka City) holds a hand weaving demonstration of Hakata-ori textile.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションをシングルに変更、位置を移動、クォーテーション内の頭文字を大文字に変更、Hakata-ori textileとしました。

sen.j: また毎年11月初旬頃に承天寺にて博多織の新作品評会「博多織求評会」が開催される。
sen.e: And Shoten-ji Temple holds "Hakata-ori fair", a new collection show of Hakata-ori textile in the beginning of November each year.
And Shoten-ji Temple holds "Hakata-ori fair", a new collection show of Hakata-ori textile in the beginning of November each year.
And Shoten-ji Temple holds 'Hakata-ori Fair,' a new collection show of Hakata-ori textile in the beginning of November each year.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションをシングルに変更、カンマの位置を移動、クォーテーション内の頭文字を大文字に変更

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 鎌倉時代の1241年に円爾（弁円）と共に宋 (王朝)から帰国した博多商人の満田弥三右衛門（1202年-1282年）が持ち帰った唐織の技術が博多織の始まりとなる。
sen.e: Hakata ori textile started in 1241 in the Kamakura Period, when a Hakata merchant Yazaemon MITSUDA (1202-1282), coming back to Japan with Enni (Benen) from Song (dynasty), brought Chinese weaving technique.

Hakata ori textile started in 1241 in the Kamakura Period, when a Hakata merchant Yazaemon MITSUDA (1202-1282), who came back to Japan with Enni (Benen) from Song (dynasty), brought the Chinese weaving technique.

Hakata-ori textile started in 1241 in the Kamakura period, when a Hakata merchant Yazaemon MITSUDA (1202-1282), who came back to Japan with Enni (Benen) from Song (dynasty), brought the Chinese weaving technique.
sen.cmt: Hakata-ori textileとし、Periodの頭文字を小文字に変更

sen.j: 弥三右衛門はこれを「広東省織」と称し、この技法を家伝とした。
sen.e: Yazaemon called this "Canton Province weave", and made this technique a house inherited secret.
Yazaemon called this the "Canton Province weave", and made this technique a house inherited secret.
Yazaemon called this the 'Canton Province weave,' and made this technique a house inherited secret.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更、カンマの位置を移動

sen.j: 独鈷と華皿の図案化は弁円のアドバイスによるものと伝えられる。
sen.e: It is said that designing of the tokko (single-prong) and flower tray was advised by Benen.
It is said that design of the tokko (single-prong) and flower tray were advised by Benen.
It is said that design of the tokko (single-prong) and flower tray were advised by Benen.

sen.j: 弥三右衛門は織物技術のほか素麺や麝香丸などの製法も習得し、これらは人々に教えたという。
sen.e: It is said that Yazaemon also learned how to make somen (Japanese vermicelli) and Jakogan (musk pills) besides weaving technique, and taught these to people.
It is said that Yazaemon also learned how to make somen (Japanese vermicelli) and Jakogan (musk pills) besides the weaving technique, and taught these to people.
It is said that Yazaemon also learned how to make somen (Japanese vermicelli) and Jakogan (musk pills) besides the weaving technique, and taught these to people.

sen.j: 16世紀、弥三右衛門の子孫である満田彦三郎が明の広州市に渡って織物技法を研究。
sen.e: In the sixteenth century, Hikosaburo MITSUDA, a descendant of Yazaemon, went to Guangzho City in Ming and studied weaving techniques.
In the sixteenth century, Hikosaburo MITSUDA, a descendant of Yazaemon, went to Guangzho City in Ming and studied weaving techniques.
In the sixteenth century, Hikosaburo MITSUDA, a descendant of Yazaemon, went to Guangzho City in Ming and studied weaving techniques.

sen.j: 帰国後、家伝の技法と学んだ新技術を以て、竹若伊右衛門（藤兵衛）と共に工法の改良を重ねて厚地の織物を作ったとされる。
sen.e: It is said that, after coming back to Japan, he made thick textile by making improvements of the process along with Iemon (Tobei) TAKEWAKA, with the house inherited technique and new technology he had learned.

It is said that, after coming back to Japan, he made thick textile by making improvements in the process along with Iemon (Tobei) TAKEWAKA, together with the house inherited technique and new technology he had learned.

It is said that, after coming back to Japan, he made thick textile by making improvements in the process along with Iemon (Tobei) TAKEWAKA, together with the house inherited technique and new technology he had learned.

sen.j: 緻密なところは琥珀織（タフタ）に似て、浮線紋や柳条の模様が浮き出たものであった。
sen.e: It was similar to amber weave (taffeta) in its elaboration, and it had a raised stripe design and willow branch pattern.
It was similar to amber weave (taffeta) in its elaboration, and had a raised stripe design and willow branch pattern.
It was similar to amber weave (taffeta) in its elaboration, and had a raised stripe design and willow branch pattern.

sen.j: 地質が非常に堅く、反物としてよりも帯として用いられ、これが博多帯の始まりとなる。
sen.e: Its nature of the fabric was very firm and it was used for obi sash rather than a roll of cloth for kimono, which was the origin of Hakata obi sash.
The nature of the fabric was very firm and was used for obi sash rather than for rolls of kimono cloth, which were the origin of Hakata obi sash.
The nature of the fabric was very firm and was used for obi sash rather than for rolls of kimono cloth, which were the origin of Hakata obi sash.

sen.j: 彦三郎らはこれを「覇家台織」（はかたおり）と名づけた。
sen.e: Hikosaburo called this "Hakata ori (覇家台織)."
Hikosaburo called this "Hakata ori (覇家台織)."
Hikosaburo called this 'Hakata ori' (覇家台織).
sen.cmt: クォーテーションをシングルに変更、位置を移動

sen.j: ちなみに「覇家台」とは中国における博多の呼称の1つである。
sen.e: "覇家台" refers to one of the names of Hakata in China.
"覇家台" refers to one of the names of Hakata in China.
覇家台' refers to one of the names of Hakata in China.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: 江戸時代になり、筑前国福岡藩初代藩主黒田長政によって博多織の反物と帯が幕府に献上されるようになる。
sen.e: In the Edo Period, Nagamasa KURODA, the first feudal lord of the Fukuoka Domain, Chikuzen Province, started to present (kenjo) rolls of cloth and obi sash of Hakata ori textile to the shogunate.
sen.cmt: 幕府→Bakufuは、ここではshogunateがふさわしいと思い変更。
sen.e: In the Edo Period, Nagamasa KURODA, the first feudal lord of the Fukuoka Domain, Chikuzen Province, started to present (kenjo) rolls of cloth and Hakata ori textile obi sash to the shogunate.
In the Edo period, Nagamasa KURODA, the first feudal lord of the Fukuoka Domain, Chikuzen Province, started to present (kenjo) rolls of cloth and Hakata-ori textile obi sash to the shogunate.
sen.cmt: Hakata-ori textileとし、Periodの頭文字を小文字に変更

sen.j: これにより博多織が献上博多、博多献上、献上柄とも呼ばれることとなる。
sen.e: This has made Hakata ori textile called Kenjo-Hakata, Hakata-kenjo, or Kenjo-design.
This made Hakata ori textile to be called Kenjo-Hakata, Hakata-kenjo, or Kenjo-design.
This made Hakata-ori textile to be called Kenjo-Hakata, Hakata-kenjo, or Kenjo-design.

sen.j: 献上博多織は青・赤・紺・黄・紫の5色を揃え、それ故に五色献上や虹献上と呼ばれる。
sen.e: Kenjo-Hakata textile has five color varieties of blue, red, dark-blue, yellow and purple, so it is called Five-color kenjo or Rainbow kenjo.
Kenjo-Hakata textile has five colors: blue, red, dark-blue, yellow and purple, so it is called the Five-color kenjo or Rainbow kenjo.
Kenjo-Hakata textile has five colors: blue, red, dark-blue, yellow and purple, so it is called the Five-color kenjo or Rainbow kenjo.

sen.j: 刈安染の青は「仁」を、アカネ染の赤は「礼」を、アイ (植物)染の紺は「智」を、ウコン染ないしヤマモモ染の黄は「信」を、そしてムラサキ染の紫は「徳」を表している。
sen.e: Blue dyed by Kariyasu grass represents "benevolence," red dyed by madder "politeness," dark-blue dyed by indigo (plant) "wisdom," yellow dyed by turmeric or bayberry "faith" and purple dyed by purple gromwell "virtue."

Blue dye, created from Kariyasu grass represents "benevolence," red dye from madder "politeness," dark-blue dye from indigo (plant) "wisdom," yellow dye from turmeric or bayberry "faith" and purple dye from purple gromwell "virtue."

Blue dye, created from Kariyasu grass represents 'benevolence,' red dye from madder 'politeness,' dark-blue dye from indigo (plant) 'wisdom,' yellow dye from turmeric or bayberry 'faith' and purple dye from purple gromwell 'virtue.'
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: 1815年、商人の山崎権兵衛が、歌舞伎役者の市川団十郎と岩井半四郎に、歌舞伎の「夏祭浪花鑑」で博多帯を締めて演じてもらう。
sen.e: In 1815, a merchant named Gonbei YAMAZAKI had Kabuki actors, Danjuro ICHIKAWA and Hanshiro IWAI wear Hakata obi sash to perform "Natsumatsuri Naniwa-kagami (Summer festival in Naniwa)" of Kabuki drama.

In 1815, a merchant named Gonbei YAMAZAKI had Kabuki actors, Danjuro ICHIKAWA and Hanshiro IWAI wear Hakata obi sash to perform the Kabuki drama "Natsumatsuri Naniwa-kagami (Summer festival in Naniwa)."

In 1815, a merchant named Gonbei YAMAZAKI had Kabuki actors, Danjuro ICHIKAWA and Hanshiro IWAI wear Hakata obi sash to perform the Kabuki drama 'Natsumatsuri Naniwa-kagami' (Summer festival in Naniwa).
sen.cmt: クォーテーションをシングルに変更、位置を移動

sen.j: その影響で博多帯が当時の流行になったという。
sen.e: It is said that this made Hakata obi sash a popular style at the time.
It is said that this made Hakata obi sash a popular style at the time.
It is said that this made Hakata obi sash a popular style at the time.

sen.j: ほかに中村仲蔵が、仮名手本忠臣蔵の中で、斧定九郎を演じた時、黒の羽二重に白の博多帯の衣装で演じ、粋で話題になりその後、定九郎の衣装が定着。
sen.e: Besides, when Nakazo NAKAMURA played a role of Sadakuro ONO in Kanatehon Chushingura (The Treasury of Loyal Retainers), he wore black habutae silk and white hakata obi sash, which was stylish and became popular, and later became conventional as a costume of Sadakuro.
sen.cmt: 黒の羽二重→black habutaeをblack habutae silkとしました。
sen.e: Besides, when Nakazo NAKAMURA played the role of Sadakuro ONO in Kanatehon Chushingura (The Treasury of Loyal Retainers), he wore black habutae silk and white hakata obi sash, which was stylish and became popular, and later became a conventional costume for Sadakuro.

Besides, when Nakazo NAKAMURA played the role of Sadakuro ONO in Kanatehon Chushingura (The Treasury of Loyal Retainers), he wore black habutae silk and white hakata obi sash, which was stylish and became popular, and later became a conventional costume for Sadakuro.

sen.j: 他にもたくさんの歌舞伎の演目で博多帯は登場する。
sen.e: Other than these, Hakata obi sash was used in lots of Kabuki performances.
Other than these, Hakata obi sash was used in lots of Kabuki performances.
Other than these, Hakata obi sash was used in lots of Kabuki performances.

sen.j: 福岡藩は献上品の品質保持を理由に織屋株制度を敷いて12戸に限定したため、江戸時代を通して品質を維持することができた。
sen.e: Since the Fukuoka clan established the weaver stock system which was limited to 12 families for quality preservation of Kenjo articles (articles for presentation), the quality was kept through the Edo Period.

Since the Fukuoka clan established the weaver stock system which was limited to 12 families for quality preservation of Kenjo articles (articles for presentation), the quality was kept throughout the Edo Period.

Since the Fukuoka clan established the weaver stock system which was limited to 12 families for quality preservation of Kenjo articles (articles for presentation), the quality was kept throughout the Edo period.
sen.cmt: Periodの頭文字を小文字に変更

sen.j: しかし明治時代に株制度が廃止され自由競争となると業者が乱立。
sen.e: However, in the Meiji Period, the stock system was abolished, and free competition increased manufacturers.
sen.cmt: 明治時代→Meiji eraは、他に合わせMeiji periodに。
sen.e: However, in the Meiji Period, the stock system was abolished, and free competition increased the number of manufacturers.
However, in the Meiji period, the stock system was abolished, and free competition increased the number of manufacturers.
sen.cmt: Periodの頭文字を小文字に変更

sen.j: 品質低下を防止するため1880年に博多織会社が設立、6年後に博多織同業組合となり、変遷を経て、出資組合である現在の博多織工業組合となった。
sen.e: In order to prevent quality loss, Hakata-ori Company was established in 1880, which became Hakata-ori Trade Organization 6 years later, and after going through transitions, became the current Hakata-ori Textile Industrial Association as a capitalized association.

In order to prevent a drop in quality, the Hakata-ori Company was established in 1880, which became Hakata-ori Trade Organization 6 years later, and after going through transitions, became the current Hakata-ori Textile Industrial Association as a capitalized association.

In order to prevent a drop in quality, the Hakata-ori Company was established in 1880, which became Hakata-ori Trade Organization six years later, and after going through transitions, became the current Hakata-ori Textile Industrial Association as a capitalized association.

sen.j: 1885年にはジャカード機やドビー機が導入され、本格的な機械織生産を開始。
sen.e: In 1885, Jacquard machines and Dobby machines were introduced, and full-scale machine weaving production started.
In 1885, Jacquard machines and Dobby machines were introduced, and full-scale machine production started.
In 1885, Jacquard machines and Dobby machines were introduced, and full-scale machine production started.

sen.j: 戦後、高度経済成長に需要が増大し、生産高・組合員数が過去最高となるも、オイルショックやバブル景気バブル崩壊で減少に転じる。
sen.e: After the war, during the rapid economic growth period, its demand increased, and its production output and the number of the association members became the biggest ever, but oil crisis, bubble economy and burst of the bubble made them decline.
sen.cmt: オイルショック→"oil shock"は、oil crisisに変更。
sen.e: After the war, during the rapid economic growth period, the demand for the weave increased, and its production output and the number of the association members were at its highest numbers ever, but the oil crisis, bubble economy and burst of the bubble caused its decline.

After the war, during the rapid economic growth period, the demand for the weave increased, and its production output and the number of the association members were at its highest numbers ever, but the oil crisis, bubble economy and burst of the bubble caused its decline.

sen.j: 1971年に織職人の小川善三郎が人間国宝に認定され、1976年6月2日に博多織が国から伝統工芸品に指定される。
sen.e: In 1971, a master of weaver Zenzaburo OGAWA was designated a Living National Treasure, and on June 2, 1976, Hakata ori textile was designated as a "traditional craft."
sen.cmt: 織職人の小川善三郎→master of weaver Zenjiro OGAWAのZenjiroをZenzaburoに訂正。
sen.e: In 1971, the master weaver Zenzaburo OGAWA was designated a Living National Treasure, and on June 2, 1976, Hakata ori textile was designated as a "traditional craft."
In 1971, the master weaver Zenzaburo OGAWA was designated a Living National Treasure, and on June 2, 1976, Hakata-ori textile was designated as a Traditional Craft of Japan.
sen.cmt: Hakata-ori textileとし、クォーテーション削除、traditional craft→Traditional Crafts of Japanとしました。(参照: http://www.kougei.or.jp/english/)

sen.j: 善三郎の子の小川規三郎は2003年に人間国宝に認定された。
sen.e: Kisaburo Ogawa, a son of Zenzaburo, was designated a Living National Treasure in 2003.
Kisaburo Ogawa, a son of Zenzaburo, was designated a Living National Treasure in 2003.
Kisaburo OGAWA, a son of Zenzaburo, was designated a Living National Treasure in 2003.

sen.j: 伝統工芸士の熟練技術をコンピュータで再現させるエキスパートシステム化プロジェクトが博多織についても1994年から始まり、その過程でカラー写真織技術が開発される。
sen.e: The expert systemizing project to realize the technical skills of traditional craftsmen by computer started for Hakata ori textile in 1994, and Hakata Color Image Weaving was developed in its process.

The Hakata Color Image Weaving was developed in an effort to realize the technical skills of traditional craftsmen for Hakata ori textile in an "expert systemizing project" that was started in 1994, which involved the use of computers.

The Hakata Color Image Weaving was developed in an effort to realize the technical skills of traditional craftsmen for Hakata-ori textile in an "expert systemizing project" that was started in 1994, which involved the use of computers.

sen.j: 試作1号品は来日したビル・クリントン大統領夫妻に贈呈された。
sen.e: The first prototype was presented to Mr. and Mrs. President Clinton, who came to Japan.
The first prototype was presented to Mr. and Mrs. President Clinton, who came to Japan.
The first prototype was presented to the President Bill CLINTON and his wife, who came to Japan.
sen.cmt: 原文にはビル・クリントンとフルネームで記載されているため、Mr. and Mrs. President Clinton→the President Bill CLINTON and his wife としました。

sen.j: 2002年には、博多祇園山笠の人形の衣装の生地として、西陣織から博多織に改められる。
sen.e: In 2002, the fabric for the costume of Hakata Gion Yamakasa doll was changed from Nishijin or textile to Hakata ori textile.
In 2002, the fabric for the costume of Hakata Gion Yamakasa doll was changed from Nishijin or textile to Hakata ori textile.
In 2002, the fabric for the costume of Hakata Gion Yamakasa doll was changed from Nishijin-ori to Hakata-ori textile.
sen.cmt: Nishijin or textile→Nishijin-oriに修正、Hakata-ori textileとしました。

sen.j: 博多織の発展と次世代職人の育成を目的とした特定非営利活動法人「博多織技能開発養成学校（博多織デベロップメントカレッジ）」が2006年4月に設立され、後身の育成が図られている。
sen.e: A specified nonprofit organization, "Hakata ori development college" for development of Hakata ori textile and training of next-generation craftsmen was established in April, 2006, which has fostered the younger generation.

A specified nonprofit organization, "Hakata ori development college" for development of Hakata ori textile and training of next-generation craftsmen was established in April, 2006, which has fostered the younger generation.

A specified nonprofit organization, 'Hakata-ori Development College' for development of Hakata-ori textile and training of next-generation craftsmen was established in April, 2006, which has fostered the younger generation.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更、Hakata-ori Development College、Hakata-ori textileとしました。

sen.j: 博多織七品目
sen.e: The Traditional Seven Items of Hakata ori
The Traditional Seven Items of Hakata ori
The Traditional Seven Items of Hakata-ori Textile

sen.j: 献上／変わり献上
sen.e: Kenjo/Kawari Kenjo (variation of kenjo)
Kenjo/Kawari Kenjo (variation of kenjo)
Kenjo/Kawari Kenjo (variation of kenjo)

sen.j: 「献上」は経畝織りし、独鈷・華皿・縞の紋を浮けたてであしらう。
sen.e: "Kenjo" has tateune-ori (vertical rib) and is designed with raised a single-prong, a flower tray, stripes.
"Kenjo" has tateune-ori (vertical rib) and is designed with a raised single-prong, a flower tray, and stripes.
Kenjo' has tateune-ori (vertical rib) and is designed with a raised single-prong, a flower tray, and stripes.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: 「変わり献上」は平織りし、紋をアレンジする。
sen.e: "Kawari Kenjo" has hira-ori (plain weave), and is arranged with design.
"Kawari Kenjo" has hira-ori (plain weave), and is arranged with design.
Kawari Kenjo' has hira-ori (plain weave), and is arranged with design.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: 平博多
sen.e: Hira-Hakata (obi woven by using dyed or scoured silk yarn)
Hira-Hakata (obi woven by using dyed or scoured silk yarn)
Hira-Hakata (obi woven by using dyed or scoured silk yarn)

sen.j: 経畝織りの無地織物。
sen.e: It is plain color textile with tateune-ori.
It is plain color textile with tateune-ori.
It is plain color textile with tateune-ori.

sen.j: 間道（かんどう）
sen.e: Kando (obi of vertical or lateral stripes, or plaid woven using dyed or scoured silk yarn)
Kando (obi of vertical or lateral stripes, or plaid woven using dyed or scoured silk yarn)
Kando (obi of vertical or lateral stripes, or plaid woven using dyed or scoured silk yarn)

sen.j: 縞織物。
sen.e: it is striped textile.
Striped textile.
Striped textile.

sen.j: 平織りの変化織り、ないし綾織り・朱子織り、あるいは綾織り・朱子織りの変化織による。
sen.e: It has a variation of hira-ori, or aya-ori (Twill weave) and shushi-ori (Satin weave), or a variation of aya-ori and shushi-ori.
It is a variation of hira-ori, or aya-ori (Twill weave) and shushi-ori (Satin weave), or a variation of aya-ori and shushi-ori.
It is a variation of hira-ori, or aya-ori (twill weave) and shushi-ori (satin weave), or a variation of aya-ori and shushi-ori.
sen.cmt: Twill, Satinの頭文字を小文字に変更

sen.j: 総浮（そううけ）
sen.e: Souuke (fabric in multiple weave with dyed or soured silk yarn)
Souuke (fabric in multiple weave with dyed or soured silk yarn)
Souke (fabric in multiple weave with dyed or soured silk yarn)

sen.j: 重ね織りし、浮けたてで紋をあしらう。
sen.e: It has kasane-ori (ply weave) and its design is formed by "uketate (raised warp)."
It has kasane-ori (ply weave) and its design is formed by "uketate (raised warp)."
It has kasane-ori (ply weave) and its design is formed by uketate (raised warp).
sen.cmt: クォーテーション削除

sen.j: 重ね織
sen.e: Kasane-ori (play weave)
Kasane-ori (play weave)
Kasane-ori (play weave)

sen.j: 紋を経糸で、または経糸と緯糸で表わす。
sen.e: The design is formed by warps, or by warps and wefts.
The design is formed by warps, or by warps and wefts.
The design is formed by warps, or by warps and wefts.

sen.j: 綟り織（もじりおり）
sen.e: Mojiri-ori (Leno weave)
Mojiri-ori (Leno weave)
Mojiri-ori (Leno weave)

sen.j: 搦み織りし、浮けたてで紋をあしらうか、経糸と緯糸で表わすか、絵緯糸で表わすこととする。
sen.e: It has karamiori (leno), and its design is formed by uketate, or by warps and wefts, or enuki-ito (figure wefts).
It has karamiori (leno), and its design is formed by uketate, or by warps and wefts, or enuki-ito (figure wefts).
It has karami-ori (leno), and its design is formed by uketate, or by warps and wefts, or enuki-ito (figure wefts).
sen.cmt: 他の「○○織」の表記に合わせ、karami-oriとしました。

sen.j: 絵緯博多（えぬきはかた）
sen.e: Enuki Hakata (Obi woven by a jacquard loom using dyed or scoured silk yarn)
Enuki Hakata (Obi woven by a jacquard loom using dyed or scoured silk yarn)
Enuki Hakata (Obi woven by a jacquard loom using dyed or scoured silk yarn)

sen.j: 平織りの変化織り、ないし綾織り・朱子織り、あるいは綾織り・朱子織りの変化織とする。
sen.e: It has a variation of hira-ori, or aya-ori (Twill weave) and shushi-ori (Satin weave), or a variation of aya-ori and shushi-ori.
It has a variation of hira-ori, or aya-ori (Twill weave) and shushi-ori (Satin weave), or a variation of aya-ori and shushi-ori.
It has a variation of hira-ori, or aya-ori and shushi-ori, or a variation of aya-ori and shushi-ori.

sen.j: 紋は緯糸で表わす。
sen.e: The design is formed by wefts.
The design is formed by wefts.
The design is formed by wefts.

sen.j: ただし平織りの変化織り以外では、絵緯糸を経糸を用いて裏とじする。
sen.e: However, enuki-it wefts are used for back knit except the variation of hira-ori.
However, enuki-it wefts are used for back knit except for the hira-ori variation
However, enuki-ito wefts are used for back knit except for the hira-ori variation

sen.j: 証紙の種類
sen.e: Kinds of Traditional Craft Mark Certificate Stickers
Kinds of Traditional Craft Mark Certificate Stickers
Kinds of Traditional Craft Mark Certificate Stickers

sen.j: 金証紙 - 経糸・緯糸ともに本絹を使用。
sen.e: Gold certificate sticker - honken (pure silk) is used for both warps and wefts.
Gold certificate sticker - honken (pure silk) is used for both warps and wefts.
Gold certificate sticker - honken (pure silk) is used for both warps and wefts.

sen.j: かつての銀証紙。
sen.e: It is the former silver certificate sticker.
Used to be the former silver certificate sticker.
Used to be the former silver certificate sticker.

sen.j: 緑証紙 - 経糸が本絹、緯糸が本絹以外の絹糸を使用。
sen.e: Green certificate sticker - honken is used for warps, and silk other than honken is used for wefts.
Green certificate sticker - honken is used for warps, and silk other than honken is used for wefts.
Green certificate sticker - honken is used for warps, and silk other than honken is used for wefts.

sen.j: 紫証紙 - 経糸・緯糸ともに本絹以外の絹糸を使用。
sen.e: Purple certificate sticker - silk other than honken is used for both warps and wefts.
Purple certificate sticker - silk other than honken is used for both warps and wefts.
Purple certificate sticker - silk other than honken is used for both warps and wefts.

sen.j: 青証紙 - 天然繊維・化学繊維・合成繊維など、絹以外の繊維を使用。
sen.e: Blue certificate sticker - fiber other than silk, such as natural fiber, chemical fiber and synthetic fiber is used.
Blue certificate sticker - fiber other than silk, such as natural fiber, chemical fiber and synthetic fiber is used.
Blue certificate sticker - fiber other than silk, such as natural fiber, chemical fiber and synthetic fiber is used.
